Ingredients.10: 2 teaspoons garlic and herb seasoning, or more to taste

Ingredients.11: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.12: 3 large green bell peppers, tops and seeds removed

Ingredients.14: 0.5 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or more to taste

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 baking dish.

Directions.2: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion, mushrooms, garlic, and salt until onion is slightly translucent and softened, 7 to 10 minutes.

Directions.3: Cook and stir sausage in a separate skillet over medium heat, breaking into crumbles, until browned, about 10 minutes. Add bacon, Neufchatel cheese, and sour cream; stir to combine. Add mushroom mixture to sausage mixture, reserving about 1/4 cup mushroom mixture. Season with garlic and herb seasoning, salt, and black pepper.

Directions.4: Warm Alfredo sauce with the reserved mushroom mixture in a pan over medium-low heat, 3 to 5 minutes.

Directions.5: Stuff each bell pepper with sausage-mushroom mixture; place in the prepared baking dish. Top each bell pepper with Cheddar cheese; pour warmed Alfredo sauce over and around the bell peppers. Cover baking dish with aluminum foil.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until bell peppers are beginning to soften, about 30 minutes. Remove aluminum foil and bake until cheese is melted, 10 to 20 more minutes.
